definition[0]: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing
example[0]: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
definition[1]: to think of an idea, story etc that is not true, usually in order to deceive people
example[1]: They invented a very convincing alibi.
definition[2]: to think of an idea for a new product, machine etc, and design it or make it
example[2]: The telephone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell.
definition[3]: to make or design something new and original
example[4]: We decided to create the software ourselves.
example[5]: For her latest book, she has created a whole new group of characters.
definition[4]: to produce a new idea, plan, method, excuse etc by thinking
example[7]: They’re always trying to think up new ways to improve efficiency.
definition[5]: to produce a new idea, a way of dealing with something etc, especially a good one
example[8]: How did you come up with that idea?
example[9]: Ellis came up with the solution to the problem immediately.
definition[6]: to invent a story, song, game, excuse etc
example[10]: My mother used to make up bedtime stories for us.
example[11]: I didn’t want to go to the class, so I decided to make up an excuse.
definition[7]: to think of an idea or plan, especially one that seems unusual or even crazy
example[12]: It can’t be easy dreaming up new advertisements all the time.
example[13]: I wonder who dreamt up that idea!
definition[8]: to invent a way of doing something, especially one that is clever or complicated
example[14]: This system was devised as a way of measuring students’ progress.
definition[9]: to think of a new idea, plan etc and develop it in your mind
example[15]: The project was originally conceived by a Dutch businessman two years ago.
definition[10]: to make, design or produce something new or a new way of doing something
example[16]: Percy Spencer invented the microwave oven.
example[17]: Mr. Monaghan virtually invented the modern pizza delivery business when he founded Domino’s.
definition[11]: to tell people something that is not true in order to deceive them
example[18]: He told investors the firm had monthly returns of between 10% and 25% but those returns were invented.
example[19]: Perhaps the most popular fraud is to inflate or invent business expenses.
